description.plain:
John Legend was born in 1978 in Ohio. He became an in-demand session musician and songwriter, working with such artists as Alicia Keys, Twista and Janet Jackson. He was soon introduced to up-and-coming hip-hop artist Kanye West, and the two musicians collaborated on one another’s demos.

J. Ivy claims credit for bestowing the “Legend” moniker upon John Stephens (with an assist from Kanye West). Via Billboard:

Kanye was like, ‘Have you heard of this singer called John Stephens?’ He played me this song from him, that I think will.i.am produced. It was so refreshing and soulful. An hour later, John Stephens comes into the studio. I told him, ‘I heard your music. It’s so amazing. It sounds old school. Man, you sound like one of the legends. You’re a legend. Matter of fact, that’s what I am going to call you from now on: The Legend.  A couple days later, we were in the lounge of the studio (Record Plant) and John Stephens walks in and everyone shouts him out. I was like, ‘John Legend!’ Kanye then said, ‘You’re John Legend from now on. That’s your name!’”

songs.full_title: All of Me by John Legend
songs.title: All of Me

description.plain:
“All of Me” is the third single from and sixth track on John Legend’s album Love in the Future (2013). Legend wrote it along with Toby Gad.

It has become one of Legend’s most popular songs, earning an 8x Platinum RIAA certification and appearing on top of 9 different countries' charts (including the US Billboard Hot 100).

Legend’s performance was nominated for Best Pop Solo Performance at the 2015 Grammys.

Legend has said in interviews that the song was inspired by his passionate love for model Chrissy Teigen, to whom he got engaged in 2011 and married in 2013.

songs.full_title: Ordinary People by John Legend
songs.title: Ordinary People

description.plain:
“Ordinary People” is a song by American recording artist John Legend, recorded for his debut album Get Lifted and released as the album’s second single.

This song was originally being written for The Black Eyed Peas, but when John wrote it, he felt it was better as a ballad and kept it for himself.

songs.full_title: Love Me Now by John Legend
songs.title: Love Me Now

description.plain:
“Love Me Now” is the first single off John Legend’s fifth studio album: Darkness & Light.

John provided a teaser of the song on his Instagram, afterwards, during a Facebook live broadcast from his home, John debuted the song and added:

‘Love Me Now’ is all about living and loving to the fullest, no matter what tomorrow may bring.

The single artwork features his wife, Chrissy Teigen.

Love Me Now complies with John Legend’s usual script of making love songs but this time he chose a more upbeat feel.

[Intro: Lenny Kravitz]

songs.full_title: Baby, It’s Cold Outside by John Legend (Ft. Kelly Clarkson)
songs.title: Baby, It’s Cold Outside
songs.title_with_featured: Baby, It’s Cold Outside (Ft. Kelly Clarkson)

description.plain:
“Baby, It’s Cold Outside” is a duet between John Legend and Kelly Clarkson, which appears on the deluxe edition of Legend’s album. The song marks the first Christmas collaboration between both Clarkson and Legend. Clarkson previously recorded a cover of the song in 2013 with Ronnie Dunn.

The song differs from Frank Loesser’s original version, in which the male pressures the female to stay the night. In the new and modernized lyrics, written with the help of Natasha Rothwell, the male is understanding and respectful of the female’s decision and calls her a cab, though she ultimately decides to not leave.

songs.lyrics:
Baby, It’s Cold Outside Lyrics[Verse 1: Kelly Clarkson & John Legend]
I really can't stay (Baby, it's cold outside)
I've got to go away (But, I can call you a ride)
This evening has been (I'm so glad that you dropped in)
So very nice (Time spent with you is paradise)
My momma will start to worry (I'll call the car and tell him to hurry)
My daddy will be pacing the floor (Wait, what are you still livin' home for?)
So, really, I'd better scurry (Your driver, his name is Murray)
But maybe just a half a drink more (Oh, we're both adults, so who's keepin' score?)
What will my friends think? (I think they should rejoice)
If I have one more drink? (It's your body and your choice)
Ooh, you really know how (Your eyes are like starlight now)
To cast a spell (One look at you and then I fell)
I ought to say, "No, no, no, sir" (Then you really ought to go, go, go)
At least I'm gonna say that I tried (Well, Murray, he just pulled up outside)
[Chorus: Kelly Clarkson, John Legend & Both]
Oh, I really can't stay
(I understand, baby)
Baby, it's cold outside

[Verse 2: Kelly Clarkson, John Legend, Murray]
I simply should go (Text me when you get home)
Oh, I'm supposed to say no (Mm, I guess that's respectable)
This welcome has been (I've been lucky that you dropped in)
So nice and warm (But you better go before it storms)
My sister will be suspicious (Well, gosh your lips look delicious)
My brother will be there at the door (Oh, he loves my music, baby, I'm sure)
My gossipy neighbor is vicious (I'm a genie, tell me what your wish is)
But maybe just a cigarette more (Oh, that's somethin' we should probably explore)
I've got to get home (Oh, baby, I'm well aware)
Say, lend me a coat (Oh, keep it girl, I don't care)
You've really been grand (I feel it when you touch my hands)
But don't you see? (I want you to stay, it's not up to me)
There's bound to be talk tomorrow (Well, they can talk, but what do they know?)
At least there will be plenty implied (Oh, let them mind their business and go-)
Uh, ma'am, I really can't stay
Murray just go on

[Chorus: Kelly Clarkson & Both]
It's cold, baby
It's cold, baby
But, ooh, I don't wanna go
It's cold outside1Embed

songs.full_title: Penthouse Floor by John Legend (Ft. Chance the Rapper)
songs.title: Penthouse Floor

description.plain:
“Penthouse Floor” is a song about social injustice in the United States. The penthouse floor is a metaphor for the upper class of a society—the idea of “going to the penthouse” represents ascension and social mobility. John implies that the opulence of a few tends to overshadow other people’s difficulties. He wishes that everybody—especially black people—could escape their struggles and have a taste of the high life.

“Penthouse Floor” was the second single off John Legend’s 2016 album Darkness & Light. It was premiered on Zane Lowe’s Beats 1 radio show. Funky and upbeat, the song includes a highly-anticipated feature from John’s Midwestern fellow Chance the Rapper who kicks off his verse with a knock-knock joke.

songs.full_title: Roll Jordan Roll by John Legend
songs.title: Roll Jordan Roll

description.plain:
‘Roll Jordan Roll’ is one of two songs performed by John Legend for the 2013 (film of the same name) ‘12 Years a Slave’ soundtrack album.

This spiritual is said to have been published “in the 1867 anthology Slave Songs of the United States; the first songbook to bring African-American folk music to a wider audience.”

songs.full_title: One Woman Man by John Legend
songs.title: One Woman Man

description.plain:
John Legend’s “One Woman Man” is about finding the love of your life and hoping to be with them forever. In his life, this woman is his wife, Chrissy Teigen.

It was released on February 10, 2017, as part of the soundtrack to Fifty Shades Darker.

songs.full_title: Save Room by John Legend
songs.title: Save Room

description.plain:
The first single from John Legend’s second album, Once Again. According to Wikipedia, with no piano in this song, it’s meant to highlight Legend’s abilities as a singer, not only a piano player. Then again, who (that listened to the first album) actually thinks that way?

Samples Gábor Szabó’s cover of the song “Stormy” by Classics IV.

“Kanye West brought the sample. I didn’t even know the original. I just knew it was a nice organ sound and wanted to write to it. I just started mumbling along to it, finding my place in the melody and it worked for me.”

The music video features John Legend dealing with a bunch of different women, who all actually represent different aspects of the same person (notice how they’re all wearing the same clothes?).

songs.full_title: Everybody Knows by John Legend
songs.title: Everybody Knows

description.plain: This song ‘Everybody Knows’ comes from Legend’s album Evolver. Generally he’s talking about his relationship that is not the best,he wants to make it work but the girl wants to leave. She does leave and gets into another relationship quickly when he still wanted to work things out. He’s saying Everybody knows that there is No Perfect Relationship in existence. All will encounter problems but its up to the couple to pull through and work them out.

songs.full_title: P.D.A (We Just Don't Care) by John Legend
songs.title: P.D.A (We Just Don’t Care)

description.plain:
“P.D.A. (We Just Don’t Care)” was the third single from John Legend’s sophomore album Once Again. Named after an acronym for “public display of affection,” the lyrics wax poetic about the many different public places that he and his partner like to go and get it on whether illegal, taboo, or not. The soulful 70’s-inspired beat and romantic melody masks its overtly sexual and humorous lyrics.

Released February 27, 2007 outside the United States, the single reached #20 in the Netherlands and #26 in Brazil where it was featured on the soundtrack of the soap opera Paraíso Tropical.

songs.full_title: Tomorrow by John Legend
songs.title: Tomorrow

description.plain:
“Tomorrow” is an album track from John Legend’s Love In The Future album. The song begins with an optimistic sample of Dr. John’s 1968 song “Glowing” before launching into a slow-churning, starry-eyed ballad about idealistic young love.

The song, produced by rapper/musician Q-Tip, employs many of the same musicians and engineers that he has worked with for more than the last decade since recording the experimental hip-hop album Kamaal The Abstract with them.

songs.full_title: I Know Better by John Legend
songs.title: I Know Better

description.plain:
“I Know Better” opens John Legend’s sixth studio album Darkness and Light and serves as its third single. The song is a gospel hymn and a connection of the social consciousness side of John Legend who showed in 2010’s Wake Up! album with The Roots and in “Glory”, the Oscar winning song for Selma with Common.
The song is less rhythmic than the previous two singles of the album, “Love Me Now” and “Penthouse Floor” (ft. Chance the Rapper), and features a soulful piano and organ accompaniment throughout the  whole song.

description.plain:
Pusha T continues his impressive run as of late, now hopping on his G.O.O.D. Music mate’s smooth single, “Tonight (Best You Ever Had).” The remixed effort replaces the original verse from Ludacris with Pusha’s go on the final set. You can also expect another collaboration between Legend and Push that is slated to appear on the emcee’s forthcoming album. Stay tuned, but be sure to enjoy the on hand reworking below.




Source: Hypetrak

songs.full_title: Let's Get Lifted by John Legend
songs.title: Let’s Get Lifted

description.plain:
In Get Lifted, John Legend tells a lover, or companion, what they will experience if they follow him into his world.

Due to the song’s slightly vague and subliminal lyrics, it can be said that Get Lifted is more than, or possibly not, John Legend promising his lover soul-touching moments and rather him telling the listener what they’re in for when they listen to his music and the album. As well as this, John Legend’s lyrics have a psychedelic undertone, or theme, and he is certainly using “lifted” to mean being high on substances and at the very least is turning it into a metaphor for what it’s like to be his partner or to listen to his music. Lastly, given the lyrics reflecting the experience of a good trip (a hallucinogenic journey created by the use of particular drugs), it may be possible that John Legend is also personifying a drug, and he is trying to convince us to not be afraid and to enjoy its wonderful, uplifting effects.

As well as this, John Legend’s lyrics have a psychedelic undertone, or theme, and he is certainly using “lifted” to mean being high on substances and at the very least is turning it into a metaphor for what it’s like to be his partner or to listen to his music. Lastly, given the lyrics reflecting the experience of a good trip (a hallucinogenic journey created by the use of particular drugs), it may be possible that John Legend is also personifying a drug, and he is trying to convince us to not be afraid and to enjoy its wonderful, uplifting effects.

songs.full_title: Again by John Legend
songs.title: Again

description.plain:
John Legend expresses the difficulty ending a tumultuous relationship on this song.  The beginning of the song suggests that the relationship was borne of infidelity and Legend’s continued infidelity makes it difficult for either person to be completely committed to the other.  Despite this, both people relent and are willing to continue their romantic engagement.

Infidelity is a reoccurring theme in many of John Legend’s songs.  He follows this song with Another Again, a continuation of the situation on Again.  On Get Lifted, songs like She Don’t Have to Know, Number One, and I Can Change, speak directly to the unfaithfulness of the protagonist.

Legend performed this song acapella on episode two, season five of “Def Poetry”:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HbL1S6l4GgE

songs.full_title: Right By You (for Luna) by John Legend
songs.title: Right By You (for Luna)

description.plain:
“Right By You” marks the eighth song off John Legend’s Darkness and Light.
The song is dedicated to his daughter, Luna, born on April 14, 2016. The ballad imagines what the world might be once his daughter will have grown. He asks numerous questions of her throughout the song, but in the chorus he reminds her that no matter what, he will be there for her.

songs.embed_content: Read “Right By You (for Luna)” by John Legend on Genius

album.name: Darkness and Light

annotatable.link_title: Right By You (for Luna) by John Legend
annotatable.title: Right By You (for Luna)

body.plain:
“Right By You” marks the eighth song off John Legend’s Darkness and Light.
The song is dedicated to his daughter, Luna, born on April 14, 2016. The ballad imagines what the world might be once his daughter will have grown. He asks numerous questions of her throughout the song, but in the chorus he reminds her that no matter what, he will be there for her.

songs.lyrics:
Right By You (for Luna) Lyrics[Verse 1]
Will you live like me, in a world run by desire?
Will you wake from worldly dreams and not be tired?
Will you work like me to lift the conversation higher?
Will you be cool like water putting out the fire?
How can you be free from all this sorrow?
Will the ones you love today be gone tomorrow?

[Chorus 1]
And if angels don't have answers to your prayers
Oh, I will be there, oh I will be there

[Verse 2]
And if who you love don't want your love, well then...
Do you cut a deal with love and run again?
You see, love contains the meaning of despair
Will you think like me? Will you  have your mother's fire?
Maybe the way we are will not be how you're wired
Will we do right by you? Will you have what you require?
To make your days on this Earth be not so dire?
[Chorus 2]
Can you choose to lead if no one follows?
And if we fell today, must you tomorrow?
Sanctify your answer not your prayer
Oh, I will be there, yeah, I will be there
Yeah, I will be there

[Outro]
And even when it all becomes too much
When you're growing old and feeling out of touch
Listen to this song and just take care
And know that I will be there, yeah, I will be there
No, I swear that I will, yeah, I promise I will
Little girl, I'm cryin'2Embed

songs.title: Same Old Story

description.plain:
“Same Old Story” marks the 11th song off Darkness and Light.
John Legend adds a breakup song to the album, in which he sings about a partner repeatedly telling a lie that they will stay together although they both know it is not true.

This song is the second single from John Legend’s album, Evolver, which features the Agape Choir.

It was inspired by Barack Obama’s Presidential campaign and was later posted as a free download on Obama’s website.

I'll stand on the highway and stop someone

I'll be home, home, home, home, home by Christmas Eve
[Verse 2]

Under the Christmas tree, together, yeah, we will be
I promise

I'm gonna walk, if I have to run
I'll stand on the highway and stop someone
I'll cross the deserts and oceans, a river that's frozen
I'll follow the stars just to find where you are
You can count on me
Make a wish, close your eyes, and believe
I'll be home, home, home, home, home by Christmas Eve

[Bridge]
Whoa, I'll find my way back to California
I'll follow the map, yeah, somewhere warmer
I'll carry my bags just until I can hold you again
[Chorus]
I'm gonna walk, if I have to run
I'll stand on the highway and stop someone
I'll cross the deserts and oceans, a river that's frozen

I'll be home, home, home, home, home by Christmas EveEmbed

songs.full_title: Stereo by John Legend
songs.title: Stereo

description.plain: John Legend sings about his girl, but he know that she only loves his music that she first heard on the radio/stereo. He realizes that she the classic example of a girl that gets around and that the relationship is way more physical than emotional for her. His girl is playing the “act” of loving him (she’s an actress). John contemplates on letting go of her and moving on to better things.

songs.title_with_featured: All of Me (Duet Version) (Ft. Hunter Hayes & Jennifer Nettles)

description.plain: “All of Me” is the third single from John Legend’s album, Love in the Future. A country-influenced duet version of “All of Me” with Jennifer Nettles as the vocal feature, and Hunter Hayes on guitar, was released on June 5th in 2014, a day after the song was performed on the 2014 CMT Awards on June 4th, 2014.

songs.full_title: Maxine by John Legend
songs.title: Maxine

description.plain:
Off his 2007 Sophomore album, Once Again, “Maxine” is a story told through the eyes of a man who recently witnessed his wife cheating on him. And while he presses her on about those recollections, we’re left to wonder if he’s coping with denial or if he’s genuinely being sarcastic.

While the positive tone of John Legend’s composition here leaves us with a charming dance tune, the actual content of the song is anything but. This adds a fun dynamic, as we’re seamlessly pulled away from a set of lyrics that can just as easily be interpreted as passive aggressive and bitter.

songs.title: Live It Up
songs.title_with_featured: Live It Up (Ft. Miri Ben-Ari - מירי בן-ארי)

description.plain:
A feel-good song that’s all about that sweet taste of victory – finally achieving success after struggling for such a long time.

Legend teamed up with Devo Springsteen and Kanye West as producers while also recruiting The Hip Hop Violinist, Miri Ben-Ari:



Miri’s worked with Legend and West before – check this live performance of West’s “Through The Wire”!

body.plain:
A feel-good song that’s all about that sweet taste of victory – finally achieving success after struggling for such a long time.

Legend teamed up with Devo Springsteen and Kanye West as producers while also recruiting The Hip Hop Violinist, Miri Ben-Ari:

[Intro]
Ha-ha ha-ha ooh...

[Verse 1]

No we don't have to struggle at all

[Bridge 1]

Come on and go to the mall and let's play (play)
Let's go raise a toast to the days ahead (ahead)
You can't take it with you when you're dead (dead)
You might as well enjoy it now instead (instead)

[Bridge 2]
Oh now, it's about to be a long evening (yeah yeah)
We'll party through the rest of the weekend (come on)
We're finally on our way
Baby now it's time to celebrate

[Chorus]
Oh live it up, we can go crazy
Live it up, you and me baby
Live it up, live it up, live it up
We're flying high, don't wanna come down
We'll let 'em know all over town and
Live it up, live it up, live it up
[Interlude]
We can fly so high in the moonlit sky
'Cause there's no more cloudy days
It's so beautiful, when you feel the flow
We can dance the night away

[Verse 3]
Do you remember when times were hard? Oh so hard
Through it all, we've come so far
(Ha-ha ha-ha ooh)
So we gotta live it up
So we can just celebrate there's no more pain
Raise your glass and feel no shame
(Ha-ha ha-ha ooh)
Oh so we gotta live it up

[Chorus]
Oh live it up, we can go crazy
Live it up, you and me baby
Live it up, live it up, live it up
We're flying high, don't wanna come down
We'll let 'em know all over town and
Live it up, live it up, live it up

[Outro]
Oh it's time to celebrate baby
(Ha-ha ha-ha ooh)
Said we don't have to worry no more
We don't have to struggle no more
(Ha-ha ha-ha ooh)
So does it feel good to you?
I know it feels good to you, yeah
(Ha-ha ha-ha ooh)
Hmm, we don't have worry no more
We don't have to struggle no more, yeah
(Ha-ha ha-ha ooh)

Yeah we gotta live it upEmbed

description.plain: “All of Me” is a song by John Legend from his fourth studio album, Love in the Future. Six months after the release of the single on August 12, 2013, a remix of the song by Teisto was officially released. The remix won at the 2015 Grammy Awards for “Best Remixed Recording, Non-Classical”

annotatable.title: All of Me (Tiësto's Birthday Treatment Remix) (Radio Edit)

body.plain: “All of Me” is a song by John Legend from his fourth studio album, Love in the Future. Six months after the release of the single on August 12, 2013, a remix of the song by Teisto was officially released. The remix won at the 2015 Grammy Awards for “Best Remixed Recording, Non-Classical”

songs.full_title: Love I've Never Known by John Legend
songs.title: Love I’ve Never Known

description.plain: A rather hidden gem of John Legend, with not much radio play or promotion of this album. Love I’ve Never Known appears on the 2011 two-disc release of Red Hot & Rio 2 which is a follow-up of the original Red Hot & Rio album which released in 1996. The album features a plethora of artists from across the globe including John Legend. This song sits at number 6 on the track-list of disc 1 and is the only song credited to John Legend on the album.

songs.full_title: Wake Up Everybody by John Legend
songs.title: Wake Up Everybody

description.plain:
“Wake Up Everybody” is a cover of the song of the same name by Harold Melvin & The Blue Notes. John Legend performed this song on the piano as the first song in his set for the Biden Harris Election Night 2020 Rally. Legend originally recorded “Wake Up Everybody” with The Roots featuring Melanie Fiona and Common as the head single for their joint album Wake Up!, of which the message is to encourage social change and awareness by all and was inspired by Legend campaigning for Obama and Biden in 2008.

Lyrically, the song calls upon the masses to become engaged in changing the world, and in the context of this performance, specifically calling upon Americans to vote in the 2020 elections.

At the end of the song, Legend noted that Harold Melvin & The Blue Notes were from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, where the rally was held.

songs.title: Family Affair
songs.title_with_featured: Family Affair (Ft. Joss Stone & Van Hunt)

description.plain:
John Legend and Joss Stone, joined by Van Hunt, recorded their own version of Sly and the Family Stone’s 1971 hit “Family Affair,” which was included in the 2005 tribute album to the San Francisco band, Different Strokes by Different Folks.

The song was released as a promotional single in early 2006, and won a Grammy Award in 2007 during the 49th annual ceremony in the now-discontinued Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals category, earning Stone and Hunt their first ever win, and Legend’s fifth.

annotatable.title: Biden Harris Election Night Rally 2020 Speech

songs.lyrics:
Biden Harris Election Night Rally 2020 Speech LyricsPennsylvania! Some of you know I spent my formative years right here at the University of Pennsylvania. I'm a proud Penn alum, but don't hold me responsible for the behavior of all of our alumni. Some of them, you know, they slipped through the cracks.

Anyway, we've got to get down to business Philly. Tomorrow, Pennsylvania will determine not only who becomes the next President, but who we are as a county. This has been a difficult year. So many of us have experienced pain and struggle and loss. We've lost friends and family members, jobs and paychecks. Just last week we lost another black man, Walter Wallace Jr., right here in Philadelphia, to police violence. A man with mental health needs, who just like so many other Americans wasn't able to get the care he needed.

So yes, we've lost a lot, but Philadelphia, what we haven't lost is our ability to decide what happens next. In this election, you vote will decide whether we're a country that allows this pandemic to continue indefinitely or one with a plan to end it. A country where the president can go to court to kick 20 million people off of their healthcare or one where healthcare is a right for all Americans. A country where the president actively encourages police brutality and cannot bring himself to condemn white supremacists or neo-Nazis or one where we hold our police accountable and begin to root out the systemic racism in our society. A country that is small, mean, selfish, and divided or a country that is big, generous, kind, and decent. A country where we remember that while we may have different politics and different beliefs, we are all Americans. And that's why I already voted for Joe Biden and Kamala Harris.

Joe Biden will be a president who doesn't take pleasure in dividing us, but one who works hard to bring us together in common cause and common effort, a president guided not by wishful thinking, but by belief in science and a commitment to justice.

Now, some people see the meanness, the bullying, the selfishness of Donald Trump and they mistake it for strength, a kind of twisted masculinity. Some see his greed and they mistake it for being good at business. Some of your former favorite rappers have been taken in by these lies. I think they've even founded a new supergroup. It's called the Sunken Place.

But Trump's Platinum Plan for black folks is nothing but fool's gold because you can't bank on a word he says. Ask the students of Trump University. Ask all of the contractors he stiffed. Ask the people his charity was supposed to help before it was shut down for being a fraud. Ask all the black and brown Americans who are dying from this virus and losing their jobs under his watch. The president isn't strong. He's a coward and his career in business and in government has been failure after failure after failure.

We need a president we can trust. That's the kind of president Joe Biden will be. And he won't only reverse the damage of the last four years, hand in hand with Senator Kamala Harris, they will build back a  better economy and country than ever before. But Joe can not do this alone. He needs your help, and tomorrow he needs your vote.

Go to iwillvote.com right now to find your polling place and figure out where, when, and how you're casting your ballot if you haven't done it. And if you've already voted, make sure your friends and family members have a plan to do the same thing. Remember you have two options in Pennsylvania, you can vote in person tomorrow between 7 AM and 8PM or you can deliver your mail in ballot in person-in person, don't put it in the mail-in person- to one of the drop boxes or election offices located in your county by tomorrow at 8 PM. And make sure you read and follow the instructions. Put the ballot in a small envelope. Don't be caught out there naked. Then put the whole thing in the big envelope and sign it. That's the only way it will count.
Remember the other side would not be trying so hard to stop you from voting if they weren't so scared of what your vote could do. Don't let them take away your vote. Don't let them take away your voice. Philadelphia we have the power to put an end to this nightmare. If we win this state, then Donald Trump will be gone and Joe Biden will be the next president of the United States. This is more than an election. As Joe says, "it's a battle for the soul of our nation." And together, with our voices and with our votes, we will win.Embed

songs.lyrics:
Introduction to “Never Break” LyricsI wrote this song as a tribute to [Chrissy and my] relationship and the fact that love can get us through all kinds of tough times, and we know that the world is going through tough times right now.

We know that Joe Biden personally has experienced so much tragedy. And what I think he's taught us and what he brings to this job, this idea of being the leader of this nation, is the fact that he's resilient, that he has empathy, that he understands what it is like to feel serious pain, that he's able to lead this country out of a serious, dark time in our history. And that's why I'm here today.

This song is called "Never Break."Embed

annotatable.title: Best strategies to reach the top of the leaderboard in Catac.io - Madboy Hub

songs.lyrics:
Best strategies to reach the top of the leaderboard in Catac.io - Madboy Hub LyricsOne of the most challenging and exciting games, Cata.io on Madboy Hub is generating a lot of raves right now. People can’t stop playing, and the reason behind this is its global leaderboard

Taking your username to the top of the leaderboard in Catac.io isn’t as easy as it seems. Players around the world are hoping on MadboyHub.com and giving multiple tries to this adventure multiplayer game but still falling short with few points

If you want to score high in Catac.io, then you really need to read further. With the help of online champions of Catac.io, we have compiled a list of the best strategies that will help you defeat every imposter in this catfight in space




Trapping the Imposter


The most effective strategy for Catac.io is trapping the imposter. You can choose any random imposter, and then you can trap him by circling him. This way, the imposter will eventually give up, giving you an easy kill


This strategy sounds easy, but it takes a lot of planning and quick thinking. The first rule of this strategy is, never be constant with your moves. Be dynamic as much as possible. If you keep circling in the same motion, eventually, the imposter will catch up. So always be unpredictable during a catfight




2.            On the edge



Another effective strategy of making a score in Catac.io is taking the imposter to the edge. It is that one place where very few imposters hang around. At the edge, you can focus on a single imposter. It is the perfect spot for trapping your enemy



There are few things you need to keep in mind while taking your enemy to the edge. The first is never to reveal your plan beforehand. Keep the imposter distracted until it reaches the edge. Furthermore, once reaching the edge, take him out once and for all




3.            Take it slow



While initially starting, remember to take things slow. Choose your kill carefully, take out the weakest first and then slowly move forward on the leaderboard. If you go directly for the pro player, you will lose. Keep yourself out of the way of pro players at the start


Find the weakest, and take them down, one by one. Remember, there is a reason why some players are at the top of the scoreboard. They know every possible strategy there is. It takes patience and perfect planning to catch the big fish





4.            The hunter and the camper



After scoring some points and taking out weak players, you need to change your strategy completely. Now, you need to select imposters randomly and then hunt them down



Choose a random imposter, and follow him around for some time. But remember, do not let him/her realise that you are onto them. Find the perfect moment, and then snap, just like Thor, go for the head




5.            The chaos maker



The chaos maker is one of the most sinister and smart ways to score multiple kills. It requires a strategy on a big scale. Things move pretty fast during this strategy. It is one of the riskiest strategies out there


The chaos maker is the imposter who uses chaos as a ladder to reach the top of the scoreboard. The first thing you need to do as a chaos maker is, find the most populated area in space. Once you find it, analyze it carefully. Find the perfect moment for entering the herd. Go for the big kill, as it will cause a lot of panic among other nearby imposters. Then carefully and with stealth, go for others quickly



If you perfectly plan out each of the above-mentioned strategies, you will become unstoppable. But, do remember you are not the only one who has the power of knowledge and skills. Visit Madboyhub.com to play this awesome online multiplayer game and good luck, may the best imposter win


Visit here: https://madboyhub.com/Embed
